alert.note: Alert for Central Oregon (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 12 at 3:29PM PST until January 14 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM PST SUNDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 15 below zero. * WHERE...Central Oregon. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 4 AM PST Sunday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 10 PM this evening to 4 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. The cold wind chills could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions can be obtained for Oregon by calling 5 1 1 or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com, or for Washington by visiting online at https://wsdot.com/travel.
